Diagram Interface creation.

timeline.bodyText:
Maybe we can be a bit more specific here.
I think it would be interesting to know that the issue is in the UI palette of graphiti and according to your investigations I believe it was related to some shells being disposed?
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText:
There seems to be duplicate logic in various variants of this method.
Maybe we can unify this a bit.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: Rectangle appears to have a getCenter() method, maybe we can use that?
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.message:
Resolved issues - (Task #568)

Resolved issues.

Task #568: Test Funcelectrical Graphiti Diagram

Resolved issues - (Task #568)

---
Task #568: Test Funcelectrical Graphiti Diagram

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we can group the dragTreeItemToDIagramEditor methods together and put the getBoundsForEditPart somewhere lower.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText:
Would it maybe be possible to infer the diagramEditor from the editPart by going upwards in the parent() method?
I think this could simplify the API and reduce the number of methods.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: you can only go up till you reach the root editPart, but you can't get the diagramEditor as it is a GefViewer element that editParts have no reference to.
replies.author: christoph-pietsch-DLR

replies.bodyText: Oh okay, so there is no way to infer the diagram editor from the part?
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: To stay consistent with our other API (we already have a method "undo" targeting SWTBotTree items) we should just call this method undo as well.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: Same as above.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: Maybe extract the magic number into a constant.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: Same as above.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText:
The name ElementConfiguration is used quite often.
Maybe we can move it into a constant? If it were to change for some reason, then it would be easy to update.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: I think for assertions we usually statically import the necessary methods from Assert.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText:
The assert equals here seems to be the wrong one (it has the float/double signature) but we are checking an int.
In fact, assertTrue(diagramEditor.selectedEditParts().isEmpty()) should be even cleaner.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText:
Should have a proper name instead of just genericaly being called editPart1.
Are they athe structural element instances in the diagram? This should be visible from their name.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: Instead generic names, maybe we can find some more informative names. I think the child here is the diagram element for an interface end? It should be clear from the name alone.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText:
Here as well, maybe we can get some clearer names.
I think here the sourceConnections are the interfaces?
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: Maybe extract into a variable interfaceEnd1, interfaceEnd2
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.message:
Resolved issues - (Task #568)

Resolved issues.

Task #568: Test Funcelectrical Graphiti Diagram

timeline.bodyText: Looks like this is still using the wrong signature. The last argument 0 should not be needed since with integers we dont need an epsilon.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: i think the signature you mean is deprecated, isnt it?
replies.author: christoph-pietsch-DLR

replies.bodyText: Only for floats/doubles. But for int values it should be the preferred one.
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.message:
Resolved issues - (Task #568)

Resolved issues.

---
Task #568: Test Funcelectrical Graphiti Diagram

timeline.bodyText: Is it a documented bug in SWTBot or is it something we with how we implemented the palette?
timeline.author: PhilMFischer

replies.bodyText: I think it seems to be neither clearly one nor the other.  Both work like expected in isolation, but somehow interplay between the two causes trouble. Surely needs a closer look.
replies.author: christoph-pietsch-DLR

replies.bodyText: OK, isee . Thus please raise an individual ticket for it, mention it here and resolve the discussion.
replies.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText: Well I think the comment descibes what is happening in a test setup in general. Maybe explain what the setup is doing, e.g. creating a blank diagram on a SEI or similar.
timeline.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText: A little bit of textual explanation would be great. I think these test cases are not clear to everyone, in particular not for people not developing grafiti diagrams in detail.
timeline.author: PhilMFischer
